result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronald R Mitchell appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Ronald R Mitchell.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Calendar Call held.  Defendant appearing in Court, Court withdrew previously stayed bench warrant.  Defense counsel requests adjourned Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald R Mitchell not in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Ronald R Mitchell.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Further, defense counsel provides an update to the court and advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Case adjourned for a Pre-Trial Conference/ Calendar Call to Br 41.
Calendar call scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald R Mitchell appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Ronald R Mitchell.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel advises Court he still needs additional discovery and global offer from the state.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ronald R Mitchell in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Court orders case adjourned.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald R Mitchell in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Court adjourns case to follow pending case 22CF1223. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald R Mitchell in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35 IN PERSON BY ORDER OF THE JUDGE.  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald R Mitchell in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with JAS (11/19/93)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ronald R Mitchell in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Ronald R Mitchell in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ronald R Mitchell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
